snippet: As more men take time off work when a baby is born, many are also filing lawsuits and complaints about how much time they can take and the professional setbacks they endure when they return to work.
abstract: More men are filing lawsuits against employers they say fail to make allowances for their roles as fathers, signaling changing views on issue long seen as affecting only women; men say they face discrimination for taking family leave available to them and pressures to leave child care to their wives; increase in cases comes at time when many fathers are spending more time with children and less time working.
lead_paragraph: As more men take time off work when a baby is born, many are also filing lawsuits and complaints about how much time they can take and the professional setbacks they endure when they return to work.

headline.main: Attitudes Shift on Paid Leave: Dads Sue, Too
